default_tags.Description: Add default tags to the resources

tags.Description: Default tags to apply

endpoint.Description: The URL to your public or private OpenNebula

flow_endpoint.Description: The URL to your public or private OpenNebula Flow server

username.Description: The ID of the user to identify as

resource.Description: Resource component of the new rule. ACL String Syntax is expected.

rights.Description: Rights component of the new rule. ACL String Syntax is expected.

user.Description: User component of the new rule. ACL String Syntax is expected.

zone.Description: Zone component of the new rule. ACL String Syntax is expected.

admins.Description: List of Admin user IDs part of the group

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

delete_on_destruction.Description: Flag to delete group on destruction, by default it is set to true

images.Description: Maximum number of Images allowed (default: default quota)

size.Description: Maximum size in MB allowed on the datastore (default: default quota)

running_vms.Description: Maximum number of Running VMs allowed for this image (default: default quota)

leases.Description: Maximum number of Leases allowed for this network (default: default quota)

cpu.Description: Maximum number of CPU allowed (default: default quota)

running_cpu.Description: Maximum number of 'running' CPUs allowed (default: default quota)

running_vms.Description: Maximum number of Running VMs allowed (default: default quota)

system_disk_size.Description: Maximum System Disk size (MB) allowed (default: default quota)

vms.Description: Maximum number of VMs allowed (default: default quota)

sunstone.Description: Allow users and group admins to access specific views

default_view.Description: Default Sunstone view for regular users

group_admin_default_view.Description: Default Sunstone view for group admin users

group_admin_views.Description: List of available views for the group admins

views.Description: List of available views for regular users

tags.Description: Add custom tags to the resource

tags_all.Description: Result of the applied default_tags and resource tags

template.Description: Group template content, in OpenNebula XML or String format

users.Description: List of user IDs part of the group
users.Deprecated: use user resource for group membership instead.

users_ids.Description: List of user IDs admins of the group

clone_from_image.Description: ID or name of the Image to be cloned from

datastore_id.Description: ID of the datastore where Image will be stored

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

description.Description: Description of the Image, in OpenNebula's XML or String format

dev_prefix.Description: Device prefix, normally one of: hd, sd, vd

gid.Description: ID of the group that will own the Image

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the Image

group.Description: Name of the Group that onws the Image, If empty, it uses caller group

lock.Description: Lock level of the new resource: USE, MANAGE, ADMIN, ALL, UNLOCK

path.Description: Path to the new image (local path on the OpenNebula server or URL)

permissions.Description: Permissions for the Image (in Unix format, owner-group-other, use-manage-admin)

persistent.Description: Flag which indicates if the Image has to be persistent

size.Description: Size of the new image in MB

tags.Description: Add custom tags to the resource

tags_all.Description: Result of the applied default_tags and resource tags

timeout.Description: Timeout (in minutes) within resource should be available. Default: 10 minutes
timeout.Deprecated: Native terraform timeout facilities should be used instead

type.Description: Type of the new Image: OS, CDROM, DATABLOCK, KERNEL, RAMDISK, CONTEXT

uid.Description: ID of the user that will own the Image

uname.Description: Name of the user that will own the Image

commit.Description: Should changes to the Security Group rules be commited to running Virtual Machines?

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

description.Description: Description of the Security Group Rule Set

gid.Description: ID of the group that will own the Security Group

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the Security Group

group.Description: Name of the Group that onws the Security Group, If empty, it uses caller group

permissions.Description: Permissions for the Security Group (in Unix format, owner-group-other, use-manage-admin)

rule.Description: List of rules to be in the Security Group

icmp_type.Description: Type of ICMP traffic to apply to when 'protocol' is ICMP

ip.Description: IP (or starting IP if used with 'size') to apply the rule to

network_id.Description: VNET ID to be used as the source/destination IP addresses

protocol.Description: Protocol for the rule, must be one of: ALL, TCP, UDP, ICMP or IPSEC

range.Description: Comma separated list of ports and port ranges

rule_type.Description: Direction of the traffic flow to allow, must be INBOUND or OUTBOUND

size.Description: Number of IPs to apply the rule from, starting with 'ip'

tags.Description: Add custom tags to the resource

tags_all.Description: Result of the applied default_tags and resource tags

uid.Description: ID of the user that will own the Security Group

uname.Description: Name of the user that will own the Security Group

extra_template.Description: Extra template information in json format to be added to the service template during instantiate.

gid.Description: ID of the group that will own the Service

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the Service

networks.Description: Map with the service networks names as key and id as value

permissions.Description: Permissions for the service (in Unix format, owner-group-other, use-manage-admin)

roles.Description: Map with the role dinamically generated information

template_id.Description: Id of the Service template to use

uid.Description: ID of the user that will own the Service

uname.Description: Name of the user that will own the Service

gid.Description: ID of the group that will own the Service Template

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the Service Template

permissions.Description: Permissions for the Service Template (in Unix format, owner-group-other, use-manage-admin)

template.Description: Service Template body in json format

uid.Description: ID of the user that will own the Service Template

uname.Description: Name of the user that will own the Service Template

cpu.Description: Amount of CPU quota assigned to the virtual machine

cpumodel.Description: Definition of CPU Model type for the Virtual Machine

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

disk.Description: Definition of disks assigned to the Virtual Machine

image_id.Description: Image Id  of the image to attach to the VM. Defaults to -1: no image attached.

volatile_format.Description: Format of the volatile disk: raw or qcow2.

volatile_type.Description: Type of the volatile disk: swap or fs.

acpi.Description: Useful for power management, for example, with KVM guests it is required for graceful shutdown to work.

apic.Description: Enables the advanced programmable IRQ management. Useful for SMP machines.

guest_agent.Description: Enables the QEMU Guest Agent communication. This only creates the socket inside the VM, the Guest Agent itself must be installed and started in the VM.

hyperv.Description: Add hyperv extensions to the VM. The options can be configured in the driver configuration, HYPERV_OPTIONS.

iothreads.Description: Number of iothreads for virtio disks. By default threads will be assign to disk by round robin algorithm. Disk thread id can be forced by disk IOTHREAD attribute.

localtime.Description: The guest clock will be synchronized to the hostâ€™s configured timezone when booted. Useful for Windows VMs.

pae.Description: Physical address extension mode allows 32-bit guests to address more than 4 GB of memory.

virtio_scsi_queues.Description: Numer of vCPU queues for the virtio-scsi controller.

gid.Description: ID of the group that will own the resource

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the resource

graphics.Description: Definition of graphics adapter assigned to the Virtual Machine

group.Description: Name of the Group that onws the resource, If empty, it uses caller group

lock.Description: Lock level of the new resource: USE, MANAGE, ADMIN, ALL, UNLOCK

memory.Description: Amount of memory (RAM) in MB assigned to the virtual machine

nic.Description: Definition of network adapter(s) assigned to the Virtual Machine

os.Description: Definition of OS boot and type for the Virtual Machine

permissions.Description: Permissions for the resource (in Unix format, owner-group-other, use-manage-admin)

data.Description: Low-level data to pass to the hypervisor

type.Description: Name of the hypervisor: kvm, lxd, vmware

sched_ds_requirements.Description: Storage placement requirements to deploy the resource following specific rule

sched_requirements.Description: Scheduling requirements to deploy the resource following specific rule

tags.Description: Add custom tags to the resource

tags_all.Description: Result of the applied default_tags and resource tags

uid.Description: ID of the user that will own the resource

uname.Description: Name of the user that will own the resource

user_inputs.Description: Provides the template creator with the possibility to dynamically ask the user instantiating the template for dynamic values that must be defined.

vcpu.Description: Number of virtual CPUs assigned to the virtual machine

vmgroup.Description: Virtual Machine Group to associate with during VM creation only. If it changes, a New VM is created

auth_driver.Description: Authentication driver. Select between: core, public, ssh, x509, ldap, server_cipher, server_x509 and custom. Defaults to 'core'.

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

groups.Description: List of group IDs to add to the user

password.Description: Password of the User. Required for all `auth_driver` options excepted 'ldap'

primary_group.Description: Primary (Default) Group ID of the user. Defaults to 0

images.Description: Maximum number of Images allowed (default: default quota)

size.Description: Maximum size in MB allowed on the datastore (default: default quota)

running_vms.Description: Maximum number of Running VMs allowed for this image (default: default quota)

leases.Description: Maximum number of Leases allowed for this network (default: default quota)

cpu.Description: Maximum number of CPU allowed (default: default quota)

running_cpu.Description: Maximum number of 'running' CPUs allowed (default: default quota)

running_vms.Description: Maximum number of Running VMs allowed (default: default quota)

system_disk_size.Description: Maximum System Disk size (MB) allowed (default: default quota)

vms.Description: Maximum number of VMs allowed (default: default quota)

tags.Description: Add custom tags to the resource

tags_all.Description: Result of the applied default_tags and resource tags

group_ids.Description: List of Group IDs to be added into the VDC

zones.Description: List of zones to add into the VDC

cluster_ids.Description: List of cluster IDs from the Zone to add in the VDC

datastore_ids.Description: List of Datastore IDs from the Zone to add in the VDC

host_ids.Description: List of Host IDs from the Zone to add in the VDC

vnet_ids.Description: List of VNET IDs from the Zone to add in the VDC

cpu.Description: Amount of CPU quota assigned to the virtual machine

cpumodel.Description: Definition of CPU Model type for the Virtual Machine

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

disk.Description: Definition of disks assigned to the Virtual Machine

image_id.Description: Image Id  of the image to attach to the VM. Defaults to -1: no image attached.

volatile_format.Description: Format of the volatile disk: raw or qcow2.

volatile_type.Description: Type of the volatile disk: swap or fs.

gid.Description: ID of the group that will own the resource

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the resource

graphics.Description: Definition of graphics adapter assigned to the Virtual Machine

group.Description: Name of the Group that onws the resource, If empty, it uses caller group

ip.Description: Primary IP address assigned by OpenNebula

keep_nic_order.Description: Force the provider to keep nics order at update.

lcmstate.Description: Current LCM state of the VM

lock.Description: Lock level of the new resource: USE, MANAGE, ADMIN, ALL, UNLOCK

memory.Description: Amount of memory (RAM) in MB assigned to the virtual machine

name.Description: Name of the VM. If empty, defaults to 'templatename-<vmid>'

nic.Description: Definition of network adapter(s) assigned to the Virtual Machine

os.Description: Definition of OS boot and type for the Virtual Machine

pending.Description: Pending state of the VM during its creation, by default it is set to false

permissions.Description: Permissions for the resource (in Unix format, owner-group-other, use-manage-admin)

sched_ds_requirements.Description: Storage placement requirements to deploy the resource following specific rule

sched_requirements.Description: Scheduling requirements to deploy the resource following specific rule

tags.Description: Add custom tags to the resource

tags_all.Description: Result of the applied default_tags and resource tags

template_disk.Description: Disks assigned to the Virtual Machine via a template

template_id.Description: Id of the VM template to use. Defaults to -1: no template used.

template_nic.Description: Network adapter(s) assigned to the Virtual Machine via a template

template_tags.Description: When template_id was set this keeps the template tags.

timeout.Description: Timeout (in minutes) within resource should be available. Default: 3 minutes
timeout.Deprecated: Native terraform timeout facilities should be used instead

uid.Description: ID of the user that will own the resource

uname.Description: Name of the user that will own the resource

vcpu.Description: Number of virtual CPUs assigned to the virtual machine

vmgroup.Description: Virtual Machine Group to associate with during VM creation only. If it changes, a New VM is created

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

gid.Description: ID of the group that will own the template vm group

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the template vm group

group.Description: Name of the Group that onws the Template VM Group, If empty, it uses caller group

permissions.Description: Permissions for the template vm group (in Unix format, owner-group-other, use-manage-admin)

host_affined.Description: Host(s) where the VM should run

host_anti_affined.Description: Host(s) where the VM should not run

tags.Description: Add custom tags to the resource

tags_all.Description: Result of the applied default_tags and resource tags

uid.Description: ID of the user that will own the template vm group

uname.Description: Name of the user that will own the template vm group

ar.Description: List of Address Ranges to be part of the Virtual Network
ar.Deprecated: use virtual network address range resource instead

ar_type.Description: Type of the Address Range: IP4, IP6. Default is 'IP4'

computed_global_prefix.Description: Global prefix for IP6 or IP4_6

computed_ip6.Description: Start IPv6 of the range to be allocated (Required if IP6_STATIC or IP4_6_STATIC)

computed_mac.Description: Start MAC of the range to be allocated

computed_ula_prefix.Description: ULA prefix for IP6 or IP4_6

global_prefix.Description: Global prefix for IP6 or IP4_6

ip4.Description: Start IPv4 of the range to be allocated (Required if IP4 or IP4_6).

ip6.Description: Start IPv6 of the range to be allocated (Required if IP6_STATIC or IP4_6_STATIC)

mac.Description: Start MAC of the range to be allocated

prefix_length.Description: Prefix lenght Only needed for IP6_STATIC or IP4_6_STATIC

size.Description: Size (in number) of the ip range

ula_prefix.Description: ULA prefix for IP6 or IP4_6

automatic_vlan_id.Description: If set, let OpenNebula to attribute VLAN ID

bridge.Description: Name of the bridge interface to which the vnet should be associated

clusters.Description: List of cluster IDs hosting the virtual Network, if not set it uses the default cluster

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

description.Description: Description of the vnet, in OpenNebula's XML or String format

gid.Description: ID of the group that will own the vnet

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the vnet

group.Description: Name of the Group that onws the Virtual Network, If empty, it uses caller group

guest_mtu.Description: MTU of the Guest interface. Must be lower or equal to 'mtu' (defaut: 1500)

hold_ips.Description: List of IPs to be held the VNET
hold_ips.Deprecated: use 'hold ips' in the related virtual network address range resource instead

lock.Description: Lock level of the new resource: USE, MANAGE, ADMIN, ALL, UNLOCK

permissions.Description: Permissions for the vnet (in Unix format, owner-group-other, use-manage-admin)

physical_device.Description: Name of the physical device to which the vnet should be associated

reservation_ar_id.Description: Address Range ID to be used for the reservation

reservation_size.Description: Reserve this many IPs from reservation_vnet

reservation_vnet.Description: Create a reservation from this VNET ID

security_groups.Description: List of Security Group IDs to be applied to the VNET

tags.Description: Add custom tags to the resource

tags_all.Description: Result of the applied default_tags and resource tags

type.Description: Type of the Virtual Network: dummy, bridge, fw, ebtables, 802.1Q, vxlan, ovswitch. Default is 'bridge'

uid.Description: ID of the user that will own the vnet

uname.Description: Name of the user that will own the vnet

vlan_id.Description: VLAN ID. Only if 'Type' is : 802.1Q, vxlan or ovswich and if 'automatic_vlan_id' is not set

ar_type.Description: Type of the Address Range: IP4, IP6. Default is 'IP4'

global_prefix.Description: Global prefix for IP6 or IP4_6

hold_ips.Description: List of IPs to be held the VNET

ip4.Description: Start IPv4 of the range to be allocated (Required if IP4 or IP4_6).

ip6.Description: Start IPv6 of the range to be allocated (Required if IP6_STATIC or IP4_6_STATIC)

mac.Description: Start MAC of the range to be allocated

prefix_length.Description: Prefix length Only needed for IP6_STATIC or IP4_6_STATIC

size.Description: Count of addresses in the ip range

ula_prefix.Description: ULA prefix for IP6 or IP4_6

default_tags.Description: Default tags defined in the provider configuration

gname.Description: Name of the group that will own the virtual router

group.Description: Name of the Group that onws the virtual router, If empty, it uses caller group

lock.Description: Lock level of the new resource: USE, MANAGE, ADMIN, ALL, UNLOCK
